connector.description:
Send data to a MySQL Database.

In you KameletBinding file you'll need to explicitly declare the SQL Server driver dependency in spec->integration->dependencies

- "mvn:mysql:mysql-connector-java:<version>"

This Kamelet expects a JSON as body. The mapping between the JSON fields and parameters is done by key, so if you have the following query:

'INSERT INTO accounts (username,city) VALUES (:#username,:#city)'

The Kamelet needs to receive as input something like:

'{ "username":"oscerd", "city":"Rome"}'

camel.kamelet.mysql-sink.serverName.name: camel.kamelet.mysql-sink.serverName
camel.kamelet.mysql-sink.serverName.description: Server Name for the data source Example: localhost

camel.kamelet.mysql-sink.port.name: camel.kamelet.mysql-sink.port
camel.kamelet.mysql-sink.port.description: Server Port for the data source

camel.kamelet.mysql-sink.username.name: camel.kamelet.mysql-sink.username
camel.kamelet.mysql-sink.username.description: The username to use for accessing a secured MySQL Database

camel.kamelet.mysql-sink.password.name: camel.kamelet.mysql-sink.password
camel.kamelet.mysql-sink.password.description: The password to use for accessing a secured MySQL Database

camel.kamelet.mysql-sink.query.name: camel.kamelet.mysql-sink.query
camel.kamelet.mysql-sink.query.description: The Query to execute against the MySQL Database Example: INSERT INTO accounts (username,city) VALUES (:#username,:#city)

camel.kamelet.mysql-sink.databaseName.name: camel.kamelet.mysql-sink.databaseName
camel.kamelet.mysql-sink.databaseName.description: The Database Name we are pointing
